ygData.subject: Scenario Converter Finished for good, finally :)
ygData.msgSnippet: Ok this is likely to be the last post announcing that my version is done, so you can all breath a sigh of relief :) As I said last night I would do some more

Ok this is likely to be the last post announcing that my version is done, so
you can all breath a sigh of relief :)

As I said last night I would do some more testing and write some
documenation as well as disabling the logger and making a release build.

That has all been done, and I've packed it all up and thrown it onto my
website.  The size comes to a grand total of about 60k (big difference from
before).

The documentation isn't in the best format, all the info I think you need is
there, it just got scattered a bit, and don't be too scared of the
Permissions part, it's just there so someone can't sue me when the program
crashes :)  I've yet to find out if they actually carry any legal weight, ah
well.
Basically all it says is that anyone can use it, and the source code, for
free and can't send me to court if a meteor happens to hit their house the
instant they run it :)

The file is up at www.twarriors.com/deathifier and I'll upload it to the
yahoo groups area later on.

As far as I can tell there are no bugs in it, I ran it over a couple more
files and after some rather odd results and a recompilation it worked fine
in the exact same tests.  If you do find problems with it please tell me, I
don't like having buggy software out there - typical indications of problems
are values in objects that don't make sense, text file lines that don't get
read or corruption of text read.  These can sometimes happen if you exceed
limits the actual game imposes.

I would have liked it to be more robust, but since the code that needs the
robustness isn't going to end up in the final scenario editor I decided it
can live as is.  If there's some specific feature you want let me know as
well, I listed a couple in the documentation file that might be useful if
you have lots of problems adding objects.

Anyways I hope this helps with the tournament scenario design and scenario
design in general.

Cya's,
Deathifier
